column1: Hiccups are common and normal in newborns and infants.
To treat hiccups that do not go away, the health care provider may perform gastric lavage or massage of the carotid sinus in the neck.
Tube insertion (nasogastric intubation) may also help.
In very rare cases, if medicines or other methods do not work, treatment such as phrenic nerve block may be tried.
